About the University of Pretoria (UP) Online Application 2024

This is to inform all and sundry that the management of the University of Pretoria(UP) is inviting applications from interested and suitably qualified students (Indigenes and International) for admission into undergraduate and postgraduate programmes for the 2024 academic year.

Before you apply, see the know the actual programs (Courses) available for the 2024 admission.

Requirements for Undergraduate Applicants

Applications for admission in 2024 is ongoing until 30th September 2024 for all undergraduate programmes. Interested prospective students should visit the UP Application Portal o view and apply online.

Requirement for Postgraduate Applicants

All Applications for the postgraduate programmes containing coursework mostly close on 31 October, with the exception of a few programmes and faculties which start to close from May onward.

Applications for research-only postgraduate programmes do not close. Just select the year in which you wish to start your programme when applying.

Before applying, I recommend you download the UP prospectus for the 2024 admission.

How To Apply for UP Application 2024

  • Visit https://www.up.ac.za/online-application
  • select undergraduate/postgraduate/semester study abroad
  • Create an Account with your valid email on the portal.
  • Fill all necessary forms.

Documents Required for UP Online Application 2024

  • Valid Email
  • South African Identity Number
  • Passport Number (International Students)

Application Fee Waive:

  • Application fees are waived for students who apply for studies at the University of Pretoria if their household income is lower than or equal to R150 000 per annum.
  • Online applicants must upload proof of income in STEP 12 of the online application process. This will serve as proof of payment, to allow you to verify and apply your form. These documents will be verified.

UP Application Fees 2024

The application fees for the University of Pretoria vary depending on the program you are applying for and your country of residence. Here are the current application fees for the 2024 academic year:

Undergraduate:

  • South African citizens/permanent residents: R300
  • SADC countries: R500
  • Non-SADC African countries and the rest of the world: R700

Postgraduate:

  • South African citizens/permanent residents: R300
  • SADC countries: R500
  • Non-SADC African countries: R800
  • Rest of the world: R1,500

It’s important to note that these fees are subject to change, and you should always check the university’s website for the most up-to-date information. Also, please note that the application fee is non-refundable and must be paid before the application deadline.

National Benchmark Test – NBT

Will the University of Pretoria UP use the National Benchmark Test (NBT) score for the 2024 intake?

The answer is No.

Please click the link www.up.ac.za/programmes to check out the programmes available.

UP Scholarship Application 2024

Before you gain the scholarship assistance, know that you (Students/Applicants) must submit an application on the MyUP Login page

UP bursaries and loans:

  • Applications must be submitted through the UP Student Portal.
  • Applications for 2024 open on 01 August 2024.
  • For more information, you can visit up.ac.za/feesfunding

NSFAS:

  • NSFAS applications are centralized with NSFAS.
  • For application dates & information please visit www.nsfas.org.za.

International Students:

  • There is an International funding application available on the application system.

Click here to apply for a Scholarship

Track Application Status:

All prospective students who applied for the UP admission application 2024 should follow the steps below to check UP admission status 2024

  • Visit MyUP Login(UP Portal)
  • Enter Username and current Password
  • Click the admission status link
  • Accept/Reject Admission offer

What to do If you Have Not Been Offered Admission in UP

If you want to enquire about the following, please email ssc@up.ac.za or call 012 420 3111:

  • You did not receive a confirmation letter.
  • Your status indicates “awaiting results” despite the fact that you have already submitted your results as requested on your application form.
  • You want to change your study programme.

To send in your complaints, please always state your name, surname, student number, ID number and contact number in your email and give an outline of your enquiry.

Regularly check the correctness of your personal information as well as the status of your application on the MyUP Login(UP Portal)
